WITCHER.Item: A particular item commonly associated with those of the Witcher profession.
WITCHER.Feat.Flourish.Bear.TEXT_ONE: The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} instead of off-guard and is pushed back 5 ft as though under the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731].
WITCHER.Feat.Flourish.Bear.TEXT_TWO: Should you critically succeed on your strike, the target is shoved by 10ft as though under the effects of a critical @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]
WITCHER.Feat.Flourish.Griffin.TEXT_ONE: You may now cast signs with the Augmented trait as a component of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-witcher.witcher-class.Item.mHWN124elnJnHURG].
WITCHER.Feat.Flourish.Griffin.TEXT_TWO: Furthermore, should this strike succeed, you may inflict an additional 2d6 damage matching the sign you cast as part of the strike.
WITCHER.Feat.Flourish.Manticore.TEXT: Each strike inflicted by Thrashing Guard results in a unique effect:
WITCHER.Feat.Flourish.Manticore.SHIELD: Should this strike prove successful, you may push the creature back 5ft, or 10ft upon a critical strike.
WITCHER.Feat.Flourish.Manticore.SCHOOL_W: Should this strike prove successful, you may reposition the creature by 5ft, or 10ft upon a critical strike.
WITCHER.Feat.Flourish.Viper.TEXT: Should you successfully perform a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-witcher.witcher-class.Item.Omv3arqxuFBdokCc]{Blindside} strike, the target gains weakness 5 to your choice of bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage from any source until the end of your next turn. If you critically succeed, the target instead gains weakness 10.
WITCHER.Sign.Aard.Shockwave.CRITICAL_FAI: **Critical Failure** The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} condition.
WITCHER.Sign.Aard.Shockwave.TEXT: Regardless of the result, the area of effect becomes difficult terrain for 1d4 rounds.
WITCHER.Sign.Axii.Domination.CRITICAL_FA: **Critical Failure** The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 2} condition should you possess @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-witcher.witcher-class.Item.66chv4diTokiXlNJ]{Axii | Puppet}.
WITCHER.Sign.Igni.MeltArmour.SUCCESS: **Success** The target suffers a -1 status penalty to their AC for 1 round.
WITCHER.Sign.Igni.MeltArmour.FAILURE: **Failure** The target suffers a -2 status penalty to their AC for 1 round.
WITCHER.Sign.Igni.MeltArmour.CRITICAL_FA: **Critical Failure** As failure except that the duration increases by 1 round.
WITCHER.Sign.Igni.MeltArmour.TEXT: Regardless of the results, the damage die produced by either sign increases by one category.
WITCHER.Sign.Quen.Ward.TEXT: You conjure a magical field of force in a 5ft emanation from yourself, granting all allies within the area a +2 circumstance bonus to their AC until the start of your next turn.
WITCHER.Sign.Yrden.Rupture.CRITICAL_FAIL: **Critical Failure** The creature gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 3} condition.
WITCHER.Trait.Adrenaline.Base: An denotation that this item interacts with the mechanics of adrenaline.
WITCHER.Trait.Adrenaline.Cost: A Visual indicator of the amount of adrenaline points needed for this particular item
WITCHER.Trait.Oil: An alchemical tool favoured by many witchers, it increases damage dealt against a particular opponent type.
WITCHER.Trait.Sign:
A sign is unique cantrip bestowed upon a Witcher through years of dedicated learning and practice.

Spells identified with this trait prove taxing to cast and thus, are limited to a single casting each turn, except as a reaction.

Unless otherwise noted, spells with this trait always cost a single point of adrenaline to cast.
WITCHER.Trait.Toxicity: Alchemical items created with this trait are naturally toxic to all but the most extreme constitutions. Witchers as a rule are far more resistant to its effects and can ignore a certain number of points of toxicity each day.
